definition: to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: Brita in grant her colony independence in the year after the second world war.
sentences.chinese: 二進制戰後的年代理英國准許其殖民地獨立。

sentences.english: Linc asks to be let out into the yard.
sentences.chinese: Linc請求准許放他到院子裏去。

sentences.english: The company is licensed and audited by the California Department of Corporations.
sentences.chinese: 公司由公司的加利福尼亞部門准許並且驗覈。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, to quiet public opinion an exhumation order was granted.
sentences.chinese: 然而，要平定公衆意見就必須准許屍體發掘的工作。

sentences.english: Many neighborhoods in France are no-go areas for women without head scarves.
sentences.chinese: 在法國，許多街道都不准許沒有戴頭巾的婦女進入。

sentences.english: She was exempted from paying tax.
Once I'd been admitted to hospital, I started the standard three-drug regime.
sentences.chinese: 我一被准許入院，就開始了標準的三種藥物混合療法。

sentences.english: Not enough permission to be human.
When the yellow light is on, it allows the vehicles to pass.
sentences.chinese: 交通信號燈黃燈亮時，准許車輛通行。

sentences.english: The topic I want to talk about is the permission to be human.
sentences.chinese: 我談及的話題是准許爲人。

sentences.english: Children are not permitted into the cinema without their parents.
sentences.chinese: 兒童沒有父母帶領不准許進電影院。

sentences.english: What if you are giving yourself the permission to be human?
sentences.chinese: 如果你真得准許自己爲人呢？

sentences.english: And give others that same permission.
sentences.chinese: 同樣也准許別人這樣做。

sentences.english: Not to permit any addition of decoration of an inflammable nature.
sentences.chinese: 不准許加設易燃的裝飾物。

sentences.english: They were granted a delay of 48 hours to gather more evidence.
sentences.chinese: 准許他們遲延48小時，以收集更多的證據。

sentences.english: In this connection, you are requested to allow the said heavy cargo to be loaded aboard.
sentences.chinese: 請准許我司將以上貨物裝船出運。

definition: to have the right to/to be entitled to/to have authority/powerful
provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
